instructions: A biased coin is flipped 10 times. In a single flip of the coin, the probability of heads is 1/3 and the probability of tails is 2/3. The outcomes of the coin flips are mutually independent. What is the probability of each event?
question:
(c)

The first flip comes up heads. The rest of the flips come up tails.
section: Exercise 5.9.3: Calculating probabilities of independent events.
